channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pro-Israel hacktivist group claims reponsibility for alleged Iranian bank hack
item.description: The apparent cyberattack comes as Israel and Iran engage in a days-long escalating military conflict.

item.title: Gardyn Indoor Hydroponic Garden Review: Better Growing Through AI
item.description: Even those with the blackest thumbs can become master gardeners—as long as they’re willing to shell out for a subscription.

item.title: Try This Free Version of Microsoft Office That Runs in Your Browser
item.description: If you can't afford Microsoft’s $150 suite of office tools, there’s a web-based version that’s free to use—and nearly just as capable.

item.title: Applied Intuition raises $600 million as it pushes further into defense
item.description: The buzzy AI-powered autonomous vehicle software company doubles its valuation from last year -- and then some.

item.title: What Type of Mattress Is Right for You? (2025)
item.description: Here’s how to pick the best mattress for your sleep needs, straight from a professional mattress tester.

item.title: Intel to lay off up to 20% of Intel Foundry workers
item.description: Rumors of these layoffs began back in April as Intel looks to refocus on its core business units and shed additional bloat.

item.title: Best Open Earbuds, Tested and Reviewed (2025): Bose and More
item.description: These wireless earbuds with an “open” design let you zone out to your music while also keeping aware of your surroundings.

item.title: In just 3 months, Ramp’s valuation jumped to $16B, up from $13B
item.description: Spend management startup Ramp announced on Tuesday that it raised a $200 million Series E led by its largest investor, Founders Fund.

item.title: Facebook announces that all videos on its platform will soon be shared as reels
item.description: Facebook announced on Tuesday that all videos on its platform will soon be shared as reels, regardless of their length or orientation.

item.title: How Private Equity Killed the American Dream
item.description: In her new book Bad Company, journalist Megan Greenwell chronicles how private equity upended industries from health care to local news—and the ways w...
